trans-unit.source: Performs administrative tasks required on a SQL Server database to support the <xref href="System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency"></xref> class when using polling-based dependencies.
This class cannot be inherited.
You can use the methods of this class to programmatically enable and disable a SQL Server database and its tables for <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> object change notifications.

In addition, this class obtains information about which tables in a database are enabled for change notifications using the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.GetTablesEnabledForNotifications%2A> method.
However, you can also use the Aspnet_regsql command-line tool to manage change notifications for a SQL Server database and its tables.
To call any of the methods in this class, the account you use to access the SQL Server database must have permissions to create tables and stored procedures.
To enable notifications on a specific table, you must have permissions to create a SQL Server trigger on that table.
For more information on how to set permissions on a database, see the SQL Server documentation.
For more information about the account used by the ASP.NET process, see [ASP.NET Impersonation](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/a0cb3024-562f-4184-9d3c-095504787d3d).
Disables <xref href="System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency"></xref> change notifications for the specified database.
The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableNotifications%2A> method removes support for change notifications from the database specified in the `connectionString` parameter.

Once you have run the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableNotifications%2A> method, you must run the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableNotifications%2A> method if you wish to re-enable change notifications for a database.
A connection string used to connect to the SQL Server database.
A connection to the database could not be established.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to connect to the database.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to disable notifications for the database.
Disables <xref href="System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency"></xref> change notifications on a SQL Server database table.

The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableTableForNotifications%2A> method disables change notifications for the table specified in the `table` parameter, which must be in the database specified in the `connectionString` parameter.

Once you have used the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableTableForNotifications%2A> method to disable change notifications for a table, you must use one of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A> overloads if you wish to re-enable change notifications.
A connection string used to connect to the SQL Server database.
The database table on which to disable change notifications.
The database is not enabled for change notifications.
is an empty string ("").
is `null`.
A connection to the database could not be established.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to connect to the database.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to disable notifications for the database.
Disables <xref href="System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency"></xref> change notifications on an array of SQL Server database tables.
The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableTableForNotifications%2A> method removes change notifications from the tables specified in the `tables` parameter.
These tables must be in the database specified in the `connectionString` parameter.

Once you have used the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableTableForNotifications%2A> method to disable change notifications for a list of tables, you must use one of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A> overloads if you wish to re-enable change notifications.
A connection string used to connect to the SQL Server database.
The array of SQL Server database tables on which to disable change notifications.
The database is not enabled for change notifications.
One of the values in the tables parameter is `null`.
-or-
One of the values in the tables parameter is an empty string ("").
tables is `null`.
A connection to the database could not be established.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to connect to the database.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to disable notifications for the database.
Enables <xref href="System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency"></xref> change notifications on the specified database.
The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableNotifications%2A> method adds support for change notifications from the database specified in the `connectionString` parameter.

Once you have run the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableNotifications%2A> method, you must run the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableNotifications%2A> method if you wish to disable change notifications for a database.
A connection string used to connect to the SQL Server database.
A connection to the database could not be established.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to connect to the database.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to disable notifications for the database.
Connects to the specified SQL Server database and enables the specified database table for <xref href="System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency"></xref> change notifications.

The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A> method adds change notifications for the table specified in the `table` parameter, which must be in the database specified in the `connectionString` parameter.

Once you have used the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A> method to add change notifications to a table, you must use one of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableTableForNotifications%2A> overloads if you wish to disable change notifications.
A connection string used to connect to the SQL Server database.
The database table on which to enable change notifications.
The database is not enabled for change notifications.
is `null`.
A connection to the database could not be established.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to connect to the database.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to disable notifications for the database.
Connects to the specified SQL Server database and enables the specified array of database tables for <xref href="System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency"></xref> change notification.
The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A> method adds change notifications for the tables specified in the `tables` parameter.
These tables must be in the database specified in the `connectionString` parameter.

Once you have used the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A> method to add change notifications to a group of tables, you must use one of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.DisableTableForNotifications%2A> overloads if you wish to disable change notifications.
A connection string used to connect to the SQL Server database.
The array of SQL Server database tables on which to enable change notifications.
The database is not enabled for change notifications.
One of the values in the tables parameter is `null`.
-or-
One of the values in the tables parameter is an empty string ("").
tables is `null`.
A connection to the database could not be established.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to connect to the database.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to disable notifications for the database.
Retrieves a string array containing the name of every table that is enabled for change notifications in a SQL Server database.

The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.GetTablesEnabledForNotifications%2A> method returns a string array containing the names of all tables in the database specified in the `connectionString` parameter that are enabled for change notifications.
A connection string used to connect to the SQL Server database.
A string array that contains the names of the SQL Server database tables.
The database is not enabled for change notifications
A connection to the database could not be established.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to connect to the database.
-or-
The security context of the ASP.NET application does not have permission to disable notifications for the database.
